identity.name: E1: The Anti-AI Designer
principles: Fusion over Imitation: Mix Swiss Poster aesthetics with IDE utility.
Emotion First: Code review is anxiety-inducing. The UI must feel 'Stable' and 'Precise'.
Content is King: The Code is the Hero. Syntax highlighting must be exquisite.
Negative Space: Dense data needs breathing room. Use borders to separate, not just space.
Contrast: High contrast for readability. No low-contrast grey text.

headings.usage: Use for Page Titles, Section Headers. uppercase for labels.

code.usage: ALL Code snippets, terminal outputs, and technical metrics.

dashboard.rules: Use col-span-2 for main charts. col-span-1 for metrics.

inputs.style: bg-input border-border focus:ring-2 focus:ring-ring focus:border-transparent rounded-md

tracing_beam.description: Glowing gradient line moving around active cards.
tracing_beam.usage: Use on the 'Analysis in Progress' card or 'Premium Plan' card.

grid_borders.description: Visible grid lines for dashboard sections.
grid_borders.usage: Use for the main dashboard layout to give a technical feel.

images.description: Abstract digital data flow for Hero section background.
Developer coding on laptop for 'How it works' or 'Features' section.

icons.style: Stroke width 1.5px for elegance. 2px for active states.

instructions_to_main_agent: CRITICAL: Do not use 'Inter' for Headings. Use 'Chivo' or a similar Google Font.
CRITICAL: Ensure all text has sufficient contrast (WCAG AA).
CRITICAL: Use 'sonner' for all toast notifications.
CRITICAL: For the Code Reviewer, use a split-pane layout if possible (Code on left, Analysis on right).
CRITICAL: Add 'data-testid' to all interactive elements.
CRITICAL: Do not use gradients for text. Keep it clean and legible.
CRITICAL: Use the 'tracing beam' effect for the analysis loading state.
CRITICAL: Dashboard widgets must fill their grid cells (h-full).
UNIVERSAL_GUIDELINES_FOR_MAIN_AGENT: You tend to converge toward generic, 'on distribution' outputs. Avoid this.
Dark colors look good when used independently without gradients. DO NOT use dark colors as gradients.
Create depth through layered design elements with z-index hierarchy.
Use glass-morphism effects with backdrop filters (12-24px blur).
You MUST NOT apply universal transition. Eg: 'transition: all'.
You MUST NOT center align the app container.
Always use modern button styles like pill-shaped, or sharp button with interaction animations.
NEVER: use AI assistant Emoji characters like ðŸ¤–ðŸ§  etc for icons.
Use 2-3x more spacing than feels comfortable.
Subtle grain textures, noise overlays, custom cursors, selection states, and loading animations: separates good from extraordinary.
